oracle.cloud.storage
Class CloudStorageConfig

java.lang.Object
  oracle.cloud.storage.CloudStorageConfig
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public final class CloudStorageConfig
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Oracle Storage Cloud Service client configuration builder. The CloudStorageConfig class implements a fluent interface to specify options for connecting to a Service instance. Instances of CloudStorageConfig are passed to methods in the CloudStorageFactory class. Example usage: 

 CloudStorageConfig myConfig = new CloudStorageConfig();
  myConfig.setServiceName("myService-myIdentityDomain")
        .setServiceUrl("https://storage.us1.oraclecloud.com/")
        .setUsername("myUserName")
        .setPassword("myPassword".toCharArray());

Author:
Copyright (c) 2013, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

getAuthProvider

public java.lang.String getAuthProvider()

Returns:
the authentication provider

setAuthProvider

public CloudStorageConfig setAuthProvider(java.lang.String authProvider)
Sets which method to use when authenticating with the Oracle Storage Cloud Service. Possible values are: "TokenAuthenticationProvider" or "BasicAuthenticationProvider." The default value is "TokenAuthenticationProvider." TokenAuthentication : User supplies a username and password and the service returns a token. The token expires after 30 minutes BasicAuthentication : User supplies a username and password. Username and password are sent with every request to the service ServiceName, ServiceURL, Username and Password are required to connect to Storage service.

Parameters:
authProvider - the authentication provider to set
Returns:
CloudStorageConfig instance
